contentrichtext.text: '''Etheldred Benett''' (22 July 1776 – 11 January 1845) was an early [[England|English]] [[geologist]], the eldest daughter of Thomas Benett (1729–1797) of [[Wiltshire]] and Catherine née Darell (d. 1790); her brother, John (1773–1852), was a [[Wiltshire (UK Parliament constituency)|member of Parliament for Wiltshire]] and later [[South Wiltshire (UK Parliament constituency)|South Wiltshire]] from 1819 to 1852. Independently well-off, she never married and devoted herself to geology which her relative, the botanist [[Aylmer Bourke Lambert]], encouraged.<ref> {{Cite encyclopedia | last = Torrens | first = H. S. | title = Bennett, Etheldred (1775–1845) | encyclopedia = Oxford Dictionary of National Biography | volume = | pages = | publisher = Oxford University Press | url = http://www.oxforddnb.com/view/article/46424 | date = May 2009 | accessdate = 2010-10-09 }} </ref> ==Biography== From 1802 she resided at Norton House in [[Norton Bavant]], near [[Warminster]], in Wiltshire, and from at least 1809 until her death devoted herself to collecting and studying the [[fossils]] of her native [[county]]. Her speciality was in the [[Middle Cretaceous]] Upper Greenland in the Vale of [[Wiltshire|Wardour]] and she was well known for her collection. She wrote and privately published a monograph, ''A Catalogue of the Organic Remains of the County of Wiltshire'' (1831) which was widely distributed. Most of her fossil collection is currently housed at the [[Academy of Natural Sciences]] of Philadelphia after purchase by [[Thomas Bellerby Wilson]] though small parts are in many British museums, in particular [[Leeds City Museum]] and possibly even in [[St. Petersburgh]]; it contains many [[type specimens]] and some of the first fossils found (and recognized though shortly after her death) with the soft tissues preserved.<ref name=phil2000>{{Citation | first = Hugh S. | last = Torrens | author-link = | first2 = Elana | last2 = Benamy | author2-link = | first3 =Edward B. | last3 = Daeschler | first4 = Earle E. | last4 = Spamer | first5 = Arthur E. | last5 = Bogan | editor-last = | editor-first = | editor2-last = | editor2-first = | contribution = Etheldred Benett of Wiltshire, England, the first lady geologist: her fossil collection in the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, and the rediscovery of "lost" specimens of Jurassic Trigoniidae (Mollusca: Bivalvia) with their soft anatomy preserved. | contribution-url = | series = Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia | year = 2000 | pages = 59–123 | volume = 150 | place = | publisher = | jstor = 4065063 | doi = | id = 2010-10-09}} </ref> She corresponded extensively with fellow geologists such as [[George Bellas Greenough]], first president of the Geological Society, [[Gideon Mantell]], [[William Buckland]], and [[Samuel Woodward]]. In addition to her own collection she made many donations to other collections such as the [[British Museum]]. In 1836 she was made a member of the Imperial Natural History Society of Moscow though it is suspected they didn't realize she was female. ==Works== [http://books.google.com/books?id=Gj8AAAAAQAAJ A catalogue of the organic remains of the county of Wiltshire], 1831. [http://books.google.com/books?id=iFW3mqE_WzgC A brief enquiry into the antiquity, honour and estate of the name and family of Wake], 1833 (written by her great grandfather [[William Wake]], Archbishop of Canterbury, but prepared for publication and footnoted by Etheldred Benett) ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Refbegin}} *{{Cite conference | first = Earle E. | last = Spamer | authorlink = | first2 = Arthur E. | last2 = Bogan | first3 = Hugh S. | last3 = Torrens | title = Recovery of the Etheldred Benett Collection of fossils mostly from Jurassic-Cretaceous strata of Wiltshire, England, analysis of the taxonomic nomenclature of Benett (1831), and notes and figures of type specimens contained in the collection | booktitle = Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia | pages = 115-180 | volume=141 | publisher = | date = 1989 | location = | jstor = 4064955 | doi = }} {{Refend}} {{1911}} {{Authority control|VIAF=43750687}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Benett, Etheldred | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1776-07-22 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1845-01-11 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Benett, Etheldred}} [[Category:1776 births]] [[Category:1845 deaths]] [[Category:People from Warminster]] [[Category:English geologists]] [[Category:English palaeontologists]] [[Category:Women paleontologists]] [[Category:19th-century women scientists]] [[Category:19th-century geologists]]
